Full screen under windows 10 64 bit


1: Open the folder where Steam has installed the game.

3: choose 1024
4. Start the game in full screen

reviewText:
It is not so bad, but I can't recommend it.

The campaign mechanics is very interesting, you control a group of 6 pilots in Iceland during a Russian Invasion (Tom Clancy Style), you can choose a pilot to control and you can change to other pilot at any moment, this is useful because there are simultaneous missions, this can be overwhelming at first but is simple.

The campaign is huge apparently, I played more than 5 hours and I cant see the end of this, the campaign is in real time starting a 8:30 hrs on day 1. and you can speed up the time 10x, I have played the equivalent to 16 hours in game time.

The graphics remembered me Ace Combat 3 Electrosphere. The gameplay is a little complicated in my opinion even after reading the manual, the success rate of the guided missiles is low even against non-moving targets, is possible to control the fighter with the mouse but I think this is too unconvenient in the dogfight, in addition you dont have ruddle control.

It works perfectly on windows 8.1 64x

In conclusion, a very interesting concept but not a very functional implementation.

reviewText: I really like the simulation genre and started with Gato on the 8088. Didthe greats like M1 Tank Platoon, Gunship & Falcon 4.0... so it pains me to give bad reviews to an already slim and seemingly dying genre but Eurofighter Typhoon is just bad. If you have never played simulators, DO NOT get this as it will turn you away from a good genre of games. (And if you like simulators, this will make you hate them... after 5 hours I could stomach no more.)\n\nCheck out Microsoft Flight Simulator instead.

reviewText:
It is a pain in the ♥♥♥ to get it working properly at full resolution, but once you do it is good game, and I think that modern developers looking into doing or updating sims like this should look at it because there are very good ideas.

As for the simulation part, when it comes to flying this is not a DCS, not even an FSX. The flight model is not hardcore, but for the time it came out it is very decent, and you get G visual and sound effects.

The only thing wrong with the game is that you have to edit a file and run it to get a proper resolution, because the config tool doesn't work. And also some people have reported problems when trying to run it, like the game not loading. Also a manual would be nice, but with a bit of trial and error you will get to know the keys and what do the markers mean, etc...


Normally I would give this a negative review because all the problems we get in this version, and because the publishers/devs/people who brought it to steam don't seem to care enough, and haven't solved this problems yet... But as there are enough negative reviews my positive review goes for the actual game when you got it running

reviewText:
This title was originally released in 2001.  For such an old game with dated graphics, it seems surprisingly sophisticated.  Actually allows mouse-driven flight, and with a standard HUD.  Reminds me of the old Jetfighter II series but with more options.

Seems to run only in a 640x480 window (using Win 8.1).  And can only utilize one CPU core, non-multitasking. Overall, for a such an old title, it seems to be a fairly good game.

Wait for a bundle offer, tho...

(Note: Acquired via a bundle)

reviewText:
Will run for me, the way I described it in my guide and not from Steam Library.

Very nice gameplay and dynamic campaign. You get to fire a lot of weapons and have a wingman that actually listens to in-game orders. You get a lot of different type of missions and get to switch between missions if you want to. Click on the mission a pilot get's assigned and make it your own.

Have you even fired Meteor's, wanted to drop 18 BRIMSTONE's at once, then this is your game.
Did you want to sneak up on your enemy, well, The Typhoon has an IR locking on system (when radar disabled). Sneak up and fire.

Play it for yourself and feel the awesomeness this game provides.

The BRIMSTONE is currently in active use by the RAF, will be replaced by the BRIMSTONE 2. See for yourself the damage the BRIMSTONE creates.

Has 3 difficulty levels.

I can only recommend this game.
